Basic.question: Which of the following is correct about JavaScript?
Among the given statements, which statement defines closures in JavaScript?
Basic.a: JavaScript is a function that is enclosed with references to its inner function scope
Basic.b: JavaScript is a function that is enclosed with references to its lexical environment
Basic.c: JavaScript is a function that is enclosed with the object to its inner function scope

Basic.a: It is an ordered list of values
Basic.b: It is an ordered list of objects
Basic.c: It is an ordered list of string
Basic.d: It is an ordered list of functions
